publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3542 Robin Harper: British Energy Finances—That the Parliament notes the decision at the extraordinary general meeting of British Energy in East Kilbride on 4 November 2002 to approve the borrowing of up to £1.6 billion; further notes that the £650 million loan from Her Majesty’s Government to the company has been declared unlawful by the EU Competition Commissioner Mario Monti; is aware that British Energy has requested that local authorities defer payment of business rates for its nuclear power stations; is further aware that Lancaster City Council has deferred the business rates of Heysham Nuclear Power Station at an estimated cost to the taxpayer of £18,000 and a possible cost of up to £1.7 million if British Energy is eventually called into receivership, and calls on the Scottish Executive to state whether any local authority has deferred payment of business rates of any British Energy installations and, if so, at what actual and possible cost to taxpayers.
S1M-3542 British Energy Finances (lodged on 5 November 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3542 British Energy Finances (lodged on 5 November 2002) Ms Sandra White*
